[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: from_gas_params()] [Limit inversion] Can gas parameters create inverted limits where per-operation limit > total transaction limit, causing validation logic errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: unlimited_at_gas_feature_version()] [Unlimited abuse] In early feature versions, can the unlimited configuration be exploited to create gigabyte-sized transactions that validators must process? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Write type discrimination] Does check_change_set() validate all write operation types equally, or can certain types (modules, resources, table items) bypass limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [State value metadata] Do state values with metadata get properly sized in write_op_size, or can metadata overhead bypass per-operation limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Event type diversity] Can attackers mix different event types to exploit edge cases in event_data().len() calculation across types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Event key accounting] Is the event key size included in event size limits, or can attackers use arbitrarily large event keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Event serialization] Can event serialization produce different sizes than event_data().len() reports, causing validators to accept oversized events? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Off-by-one] At line 105, can write_op_size == max_bytes_per_write_op pass validation but fail during actual write? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Off-by-one] At line 110 and 122, are the > comparisons susceptible to off-by-one errors at exact limit boundaries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Limit edge case] Can transactions with sizes exactly at u64::MAX-1 cause overflow in subsequent calculations after passing checks? (Medium)
